review: Red robin is one of this places you cant pass up  from the lively environment to the cheap and fast service.  Oh did I add they have bottomless steak fries and I can't juat have one batch.  Their probably one of the few restaurants who actually offer an actual free meal on your birthday when your signed up for their birthday program. I can't get enough of their veggie burgers they do them right yessirrrr!

Zach at the front knew we came in first, made eye contact with us, chose the couple that came in well after us. We said something to him, he didn't care.  We immediately walked out. Learn how to treat your customers. I'm starving, my kid is hungry, but being disrespected like that put a bad taste in our mouth.

UPDATE: After my review I was informed of a website:  This website allows you to look up any food facility in Chesapeake and view a list of their violations. This location of Red Robin had violations in June 2017 for employees not washing their hands, uncovered food, unclean surfaces and more. No inspection or re-inspection has been done since June 2017. YUCK!!! JULY 2017 POST: This Red Robin location is filthy.  The menus are sticky, the condiments left on the tables are sticky and the seats are never wiped down very good.  The floors under the table are nasty with food so you constantly step in it.  Yuck!!  You can watch the kitchen staff as the kitchen is open to the sitting area. We never saw any hair nets, beard nets, and gloves were few and far between.  We watched people rub the sweat from their head, wipe their nose with the back of their hand, scratch their arm, etc... and then proceed to cook the food.  It amazes me that food manufacturing plants have staff fully covered (head cover, facial hair cover, foot covers, and gloves - all in order to protect your packaged food. Yet, many restaurants just don't care.  When I see this stuff, I just lose my appetite.   They really need to step up their cleaning routine. How does this stuff pass with the inspectors?  If this is just what we could see, what did the place look like that we could not see?  Scary to think about. When you go - make sure you take several antibacterial wet wipes with you!  The wait staff is hit or miss on a good one.  You can tell some just hate their jobs and it reflects in their attitude. You have to accept their rudeness isn't personal and ignore it or ask for someone else.   Last, this is a family restaurant so 80% of the time there will be loud/screaming kids.   Did I mention they have a full bar?  I highly recommend you visit this.  It helps you ignore all of the above concerns.

Good burger chain! Food is always consistent, as the service is as well. If you sign up for the reward program, discounts, updates and specials always pop up and most of them are relevant to what I like. I have been several times and I always leave satisfied!

I'm here for the burgers and the chicken sandwiches!  I haven't tried anything else, but this place always delivers deliciousness. Yearly, I receive a birthday burger reward and I'm always looking forward to redeeming it.  So this year, I ordered the Teriyaki Chicken.  Super amazing!! It features: grilled chicken breast, teriyaki, grilled pineapple, melted Swiss, lettuce, tomatoes and mayo for $9.99.  But I had it without the tomatoes and mayo.   Super good!!   But on any day you'll pay $9.99, but if you sign up for their awesome birthday program you received a gourmet burger/chicken sandwich for FREE!   Definitely something to look forward too! The sandwich also comes with a side and I ordered broccoli.  So good!!   Cooked to perfection and seasoned just right.  My orders are usually to-go and the pick up is at the bar area!  Although I have dined here one time and it was on the patio - beautiful!  I love it here and will continue to come again and again. Have fun and enjoy life!

I would most definitely give this location a 0! I was extremely disappointed!! My food was COLD! The cheese and chicken were very, very cold! I ordered the whisky river bbq chicken wrap. I order that at every Red Robin I go to, and it was just an awful experience. I wasn't pleased with the waitress what's so ever. The fries were hard and room temperature and the waitress didn't even offer if we wanted any more fries! IWILL NOT be returning. I was very displeased. Practically any other location is better. The greeters were bad as well. When we walked in the male greeter assumed we weren't first and treated us poorly!! Then as we were leaving we did not receive a "have a nice day" greeting. Other Red Robin's I have been too exemplifies top notch service and this was does not whatsoever!!!

I love Red Robin. I am obsessed. My absolute favorite is just a classic cheeseburger. Red Robin tavern is what I dream about at night. Two mini patties with lettuce, tomato, onion, and cheese. Insert heart eyes emoji.  Hubby has been on the blue ribbon kick. He's obsessed. And he loves the onion straws.  The sweet potato fries are really good. Their salad is good. Their broccoli is good. Their fries are terrible.  I hate their fries. They're steak fries. But I can look past it for their burgers. But please get rid of the steak fries. And we upgraded to Parmesan garlic fries. Not worth it. Not much garlic flavor and just seems like they're dripping in oil. And once again, they're steak fries. Ughhhh.  Pro tip: get the chipotle aioli and mix it with ketchup. Sweet and spicy dip for your fries. Or sauce your burger up with it.

Great food and service by Rick. Love the mini wedge salad and burgers are always hot and  fresh. We tried two new items, Poppin Purple Lemonade and the Towering Doh! Rings. They have a great loyalty program, too

My family has patronized Chesapeake Square Red Robin for years but after yesterday we won't be returning. My elderly mother-in-law made a simple food preparation request that every other Red Robin fulfills without question but yesterday evening she was flat out denied "by the manager"! There are plenty of other choices in this area and Red Robin will no longer be on our list.

Le sigh - 46 reviews. I need to invest stock in this particular store. If you follow my reviews you can see an evolution in my visits. This place is continually evolving. It's almost sad how welcomed we are when people see us (we're good tippers too), but it's nice seeing them improving little by little. Change on this type of a magnitude doesn't happen easily as it has to be a culture change. Overall, the food quality has become more consistent and service tight. I like it and am happy to recommend going here. I'll be back (clearly) and will update as needed. =) Food taste - 4 Overall Service - 4 - depends at times, becoming more consistent Value of food to cost - 4 Facility - 4 Repeat customer? - yes Dog friendly? - no TL;DR - Kid friendly, better service, better quality food

I came to actually get my free birthday burger. For those who don't know if you are a royal Red Robin member one of the perks is that you get a free burger and fries during your birthday month. The cool thing about here is that you get the entire month to use it! Most places do within a week or the same day so that is pretty awesome. Had some zesty ranch dip and chips for an app. The dip was good and there was a lot of it. It actually tasted great with the fries I had later on. I decided to go with the burnin love burger on ciabatta bread. I asked for it cooked medium and it was the most perfectly cooked burger. Couldn't have asked for it to be cooked any differently. It was soooooooo good. Can't wait to go back. Red Robin is one of those places I don't go to often, but then when I do I always question what took me so long to return lol.

Even though I used to go here for my lunch break at least once a week when I worked at Dillard's in Chesapeake Square Mall (throwback!), I can't remember a single thing I ever ate. Literally. I can tell you my lunch date liked his food and ginormous beer and service was quick cause we got back to work in an hour. But that was when Chesapeake Square wasn't dying because Harbour View was still just a buncha land with nothing going on except [Broken] Egg Bistro, Walmart, and Tropical Smoothie. But I digress.  Ten years later, I'm eating Red Robin Burgers. Once a year. Cause they're free on your birthday, when you sign up in advance. But even if they weren't free, I just might pay for one of those bad boys. Much better than the free Ruby Tuesday birthday burger options. And well, if you're gonna get a chain restaurant's burger, you should get the best. Red Robin. Yum.

I would be lying if I said I didn't love burgers. Red Robin is a stop we make about every 2-4 months because it's in the neighborhood.  An average faster food place. My biggest gripe? My heart sinks when I think of their fries. A burger place that give bottomless fries yet never are they hot, fresh fries. Not ever. I don't want bottomless bad fries. I assume it is an economic strategy - intentional done to discourage reordering, to balance out the 'bottomless' aspect.  I had The Southern Charm $13.99 tonight, some pink. Cooked nicely. Pink and juicy. That was good. Ciabatta bun was uninspiring and cold, grainy. Bad pairing. The burger was shockingly sweet, so sweet. No kidding. There was brown sugar all over the place and hardly any grilled onions to balance it out. I did not enjoy this burger. And regretted paying that kind of money for what I received. What I do normally like are the short stack onion rings. This evening there was a bitter aftertaste that comes from frying different things in the same oil too many times. A disappointment for us since this is something that usually goes well. They keep your Soda refilled. We all have our quirks, and this is a big thing with me. That's 1 star right there. The monthly special burger is usually good, though they may not be able to make it the same way twice.

We have eaten here many times and the food is good and the waitstaff friendly. The most recent three times we have eaten on the patio so our dog could be with us. Our dog is better behaved than a lot of people. Each of those times we were the only people outside. We were just turned away, because dogs are no longer allowed. We will not be back.

Tonight was by boyfriend's turn to chose where we were going to eat. Red Robin was the chosen destination, Yum! For a Friday night I was expecting a long wait but we sat done as soon as we got in. The noise level was average and our server greeted us as soon as we were seated. I had the sombrero salad which was a lot of food and soo tasty!

I'm giving this restaurant 4 stars out of 5 only because we ordered mozzarella sticks for an appetizer and never received it. Our server name was Jayy(that's how she spelled it on her name tag), she was very nice and checked on us frequently. My husband and I ordered the guacamole burger, it was fresh, juicy and cooked to perfection. We had endless fries and that's why we didn't get upset about our appetizer. The bathroom was very clean as well, I was impressed and made me confident to eat in a nice clean restaurant. So many burgers to choose from. Family friendly atmosphere and great service. I highly recommend coming here.

I've been slacking with my reviews lately, and I realized I have never written a review for one of my favorites--Red Robin Gourmet Burgers (RR). Ever since I became a Yelp addict, I pretty much stay away from chains. However, RR is one of the exceptions.  There is something about the atmosphere at RR that I enjoy. The décor is fun, and the dining room is open, but it can become very loud when it's busy. When we walked in the other day, we noticed they had remodeled and the sign said: "Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews." The new décor is a bit classier and upscale--we loved it! They also now have touchscreen Ziosk tablets on all tables, which enables customers to order food on their own and not needing to wait for the bill at the end of their meal.  We have always had good service at RR, but sometimes it can take a while for the food to come out. On our last visit using the Ziosk, our food was super fast. I think Ziosk will help with that particular issue. Our waitress was awesome--friendly, knowledgeable, and prompt. If you need your server, there is a "call your server" button on your Ziosk.  Most of the time, we all order burgers and we are happy with their food. I've also tried many of their salads and appetizers--pretty decent. Just like most chains, their food can be salty depending on what you order. I would recommend sticking with their burgers as that's what they do best. Bonus: you get bottomless fries with your burgers! RR is a popular choice for my family because of many different reasons:  1) It is fairly close by.  2) My boys love burgers, and sometimes I want a sit-down meal instead of fast food burgers.  3) We all can agree on RR.  4) Baron's Pub in town is a better value and better burgers, but sometimes I'm looking for the atmosphere.  5) RR really caters to families. I am a fan, Red Robin! Yummmmmmm...

Red Robin is a great family friendly restaurant.  It's a great place to bring kids too, but adults will enjoy the experience too. I love the freckled lemonade. They have every type of burger u can imagine, and u can custom make your burger too. U get unlimited fries with every burger. They have salads and other non burger items, but really this place is famous for their burgers. Their chili burger is so big it's served open face and it's delicious. I wanted something smaller so I had a bacon red tavern burger and it has to be one of my favorite burgers there. They also have a full bar, that's always a plus.

Standard chain restaurant. Our burgers were was we ordered and tasted fine. The fried were gone as well, we enjoy them with the spicy ketchup and seasoning blend. Service was ok. I wish they had a better craft beer selection. Overall everything was fine, just not super impressive.
I ordered the "House Margarita" because it seemed to be a good deal.  It was gone in 4 sips.  What a rip off.

The French fries are NEVER done. When you hold a French fry, they're supposed to stand straight up, not lay to the side being limp. I tried to call the general manager of the store (Lenny) and he did nothing to appease the situation, so I called corporate. They gave me a $10 Red Robin Royalty credit on my account, but that doesn't make this specific restaurant any better. If you want good French fries, don't go here. Period.

I am figuring out here the food is always consistently good but the service is not depending on your server based on multiple visits over a period of a week. We had horrible service one night when we went in at 9 (an hour before they closed) but the following week at 8 service was much better.   I enjoy the freckled lemonade and unlimited fries!

Consistently good food, good service, clean establishment.  Even checking health department records, they consistently do great. My favorite is the banzai burger. Endless fries are a plus and we recently found out that the salad that you can get as a side is also endless.
Always a good time when we go to Red Robin!!!! Kid-friendly atmosphere, great food, great customer service! Never disappointed by the food & the Freckled Strawberry Lemonade is a must-have!!!
Wonderful burgers. Great service as always. Love this place! Hubby and I came for Fathers Day lunch. It's one of his favorite places for a great burger.

I was shopping at Chesapeake mall & took a moment to call Red Robin to order a take out dinner to bring home. The lady on the phone was very pleasant and prompt with my order stating that my order would be ready in 12 minutes. Walking in to restaurant a couple of minutes later & paid for dinner at the bar, my order was immediately brought out hot and ready to take home. The whole process couldn't have taken 5 minutes. Red Robin is my new must go to place now for a quick and stress free meal. Thank you Red Robin!!

With over 20 different burger selections on the menu, I chose the Boca vegan burger because I do not eat red meat. it was okay, but I might opt for the garden burger next time. I really only go here for the bottomless fries, which are always great. I sipped on a PBR while I was there, and watched some English Premier League. this restaurant has a very lively atmosphere at almost any time that you go. they have a very good mixed crowd. It's a very clean restaurant and the staff is extremely friendly. my server was Bri and she did an excellent job.

Will not come here again. Mediocre food. Poor management. A member of our party just signed up for the Royal Club today but they refused to honor the birthday reward. The excuse we were given by Eric the manager was it takes 24 hours to actually register and we could use it next time. Except now there won't be a next time. On top of that he got an attitude with us.

I am a frequent patron of Red Robin, I stopped by for my Royalty birthday burger and was very disappointed. I requested the Burnin' love burger, medium well with endless fries. The order took a little longer than usual; but it was lunch time. No big deal... My meal arrived. The presentation was great, the kaiser roll was fresh and topped with a large jalapeño. The fries were hot, just as I like it...however, there was no ketchup on my table. Halfway through my overcooked burger, the waitress returned and asked me, "how is everything?" I requested ketchup, and she returned with the Heinz. I finished my meal and attempted to check out by way of the kiosk... having some challenges, I activated the request server function. 10 minutes later, my waitress arrives; swipes my royalty card and tells me it didn't go through...because I didn't finish the registration. I told her that was not true and that I had logged in the night before. She said, let me find out what happened. She returned and said, you are right, happy birthday. I have 3 issues. 1. The overcooked burger. 2. I was halfway through the meal before the waitress checked on me. No ketchup. 3. Several of the staff members walked by the table, with the kiosk blinking red for 10 minutes. Request Server.... That's not acceptable.

took my wife and three daughters out to eat. my middle child is not big on burgers but to her surprise she had plenty of salad's, sandwiches and entrées to choose from. I had the billion dollar baby burger and it was excellent. the whole family enjoyed their meals. The staff was friendly and very Helpful. the restaurant was clean. we also got to watch Monday night football. on the way out I noticed they had the game sound on in the bar area. I know where I'm going to be next Monday. great overall experience.

we went for lunch and had the bartender as our waitress who just wasn't on her game. I had an empty water glass for at least 15 minutes (pet peeve) and she forgot our starter salads.  Other than the service, everything was GREAT as usual. This is our first time at this Red Robin but always love the food. The banzai burger is my go-to and my husband loves the one with the egg on it. I always pay the .99 up charge for the garlic fries. Sometimes we get the towering onion rings (so good) and the banana milkshake is also amazing!
Burger was dry and overcooked. And by overcooked I mean charred on the outside, even though I asked for medium well. Customer service was pretty good, but I'm good on Red Robin. Won't be back.

Everything was alright .. NOTHING to really write home about!!!  Service was great thanks to Deshia, our server. Really let down that even though we both ordered appetizers, we couldn't get our endless fries until they were served with our entrees!!! Due to the logistics of our food being served, that rule actually caused one order of fries to go to taste!!

Pretty good. There is a very big menu available. I love that the French fries are bottomless and the kids meals as well! YES you heard me right. The kids can get as much food as they like! The price is moderate.

This place is......it's OK. Clean and quiet on a Sunday evening but the food is mediocre and our drinks were just bad. The absolutely absolute freckled lemonade came with old strawberries and was just nasty I sent it back. Their raspberry limeade with Sprite was gross and I also had to send it back. Our waiter was nice and her service was great...everything else was just not that good. It was just OK.
Poor service, way too slow and some overcooked food, the manager gave a free burger but between the food and the loud noise I can't rate it highly. I go because friends love it. Not a fan

First visit to this chain.  I went to this location at lunchtime, soon after its 11 am opening. The server asked if I had ever been here before, and I did state that this was my first visit to a Red Robin.  At that point she gave me the menu and went away.  I would have appreciated a little more information about how I could order the burgers or other menu items. I ordered the Royal Red Robin, which included a fried egg, cheese and bacon on top of the burger.  "Unlimited" steak fries are included with the order. Minimal waiting, burger and fries served in a basket.  Ample sized burger, and the taste of the fried egg really added to the flavor. Good lunch, but not enough of a "destination" restaurant that I will seek out Red Robin over other restaurants.

I feel like you can't go wrong with this Red Robin. Their fries and seasonings are great. I love that you can order different sauces for them now. My best friend loves that you can get any of the sandwiches in a lettuce wrap if you want. Their drinks are delicious and they have fast service. It was a bit of a wait to get seated but that's usually typically for this area on a Saturday night.

I've had bad experiences a couple of times at Red Robin, so this we a pleasant surprise.  Or server was terrific, and knowledgeable.  The food was great and the atmosphere was agreeable. We had a great time.

I have visited this location many times.  If today's visit was my first I would Never Return Again.  Something is going on at this Location.  The last Few Times I have been here things haven't been up to the Quality and Service that is expected at Red Robin.  I am measuring Red Robin to itself. The question of whether or not you like them as a restaurant is different on its on merit.  Food is slow coming out.  Orders not filled correctly.  Wait Staff everywhere except around when you want them.  I observed a Glass Tray left on the ground a small Child stubbed it's foot on it.  The staff was clueless.  It was just Bizarre.  Everyone looks stressed.  I still like Red Robin, but I'm wondering what is going on.  I will be back at this location if for no other reason than to update on the train wreck.

I went to Red Robin tonight with my wife.  I hoped they still had the appetizer of Mini Brats and they did.  Those things are awesome!!  (I posted photos of them)  The service was great.  We were being seated in the big room and I asked if we could sit in the bar area - it is usually a little quieter.  No problem. Our waitress Mary was very good - kept drinks refilled and dilivered food timely and helped with special requests for extra pickles and rang up a beer on happy hour price just in time (and delivered it when I was ready).   I also liked that the Manager came by and asked how everything was.  I was glad to inform him it was great. The burgers were awersome as always.  I had the Bacon Cheese Burger w Blue Cheese and Monica had the Chop House Burger - both were hot and cooked the way we requested.  We had a Caesar Salad before our burgers and after the mini Brats and it was very good and served with a tasty piece of Pita. This isn't the cheapest place to go for a burger but the service was great and the food was delicious and it is the only place I know of with Mini Brats with that great relish as an appetizer. I'll be back (and soon I hope).

Ok Red Robin I see you have updated the place! I like! We came here, a party of 3, looking for a good burger. They did not let us down! I ordered the Peppercorn A1 steakhouse burger and it was WHOA! So good! My husband got the new Smoke &Pepper burger and he said it was super flavorful. The kiddo got the Mac n cheese and loved it of course. Here is where my problem comes in. I can appreciate the new "gourmet burger" approach but why lose the stuff that made me like u to begin with?! So they still have bottomless fries but they stopped the second bowl of mac n cheese for the kids! My 5 yr old was like "what the what!" Then I asked for a side of the chipotle aioli because I wasn't sure if I would like it on my burger... It was good. But they charged me .75 for it!! Since when do u charge for condiments? Then the low key "enjoy the entertainment console while u wait" and then charged us $2 for my girl playing tic tac toe... And then the automatic added 18% gratuity if u don't catch it u might give more than u intended. So, it was good food, a nice server but look out for the nickel and diming..

I have eaten at Red Robin a number of times as I have a 12 year old son who loves the place.  Everything about this location is just ok.  The service here is disappointing, I've yet to have a really good server which is sad as I've eaten here well over 10 times. My most recent visit I went with my husband and son.  I cannot remember what they ordered but it must have been tasty as they inhaled their burgers almost as soon as they hit the table.  As for me I ordered the guacamole burger (medium) and as far as I could tell there wasn't a speck of guac on that burger and it was certainly cooked well done (actually VERY well done would be a better description)  I asked the server if I could get a side of guac so that I could salvage the meal however, when she brought it out to the table I could see why they neglected to put it on the burger.  It was mostly brown, not fresh at all and tasted horrid!  I was so shocked, at this point I ended up just sending it back, as I'd only taken two bites of my burger and only had one or two of my sweet potato fries. I did point out to the server that I asked for my burger medium and that it was past well.  She kinda mumbled an apology and took the meal away and off of your check.  The manager did come over and ask it she could make me something else, I declined.  All and all it was a disappointing visiting.  I will return again just no time soon.

The service is always great. I never had to wait long for food or the check. I have two boys and this is there favorite place to eat. I normally get the whiskey burger and it's so good I haven't had the guts to try anything new. I will the next time
OMG got the meatball lolly pops for our granddaughter and she loved them! Had to wait about 15 minutes for a table for four, but they do make awesome burgers! Also unlimited fries are never ending
When you go there ask for Frankie....the best waiter hand down .RR food is on point ,drinks are good, and those fires are the best.

My husband and I find ourselves stopping by  Red Robins at least  one to two times a month. We like the new menu and the new makeover.  David was our server this evening 3/29.  He did an excellent job and was very courteous.  Love the Berserker Burger.

My family has eaten here many times, but this was the first time we got a raw-meat burger! I kid you not, this burger was bright red in the center, not pink, but red and bloody. Honestly, how hard can it be to cook a burger at a burger joint. It is all you do, day in and day out. Red Robin should be able to cook burgers in their sleep.  It must be a Chesapeake Square Mall thing, because a few years ago, the Outback Steak House there served me a raw-meat steak. It had been braised on the outside, but all purple on the inside. Yuck! RR made things worse, when they refused to comp the entire meal. When you poison one member of the family with a  raw-meat burger, it might go along way to comp the $4.99 kids meal too. I guess RR feels that raw-meat or not, we're all stupid and will probably be back. Nope, never again! Now my wife is waiting for a full bore case of E-coli now. It's like waiting for Santa to arrive....from hell! Yuck!

Our go-to for eating out with the kids and a screaming toddler! The food isn't rocket science, but they do offer an assortment of salads and sandwiches with a ton of kids menu options and not too shabby wine list. Plus...who can turn down endless steak fries? The service is also friendly and accommodating to our LOUD TABLE of kids so really, what more can you ask for?

Red Robin is what I would expect it to be, another chain restaurant that offers decent food. There is nothing wrong with the burgers and the bottomless fries are good, considering that they're bottomless, it makes it a little bit better. Our waitress did a great job, considering we had a party of 22. I have never had a problem with Red Robin and it cracks me up when person has one bad experience out of the many times they have been and they give them one star. I don't think one star is warranted, but anything above average is crazy talk.  :)

Food: This was my first time at Red Robin and I was not disappointed. I got the A1 Peppercorn Burger without fried onions. I decided to get sauteed onions instead and it came out good. They let me substitute the bun for a Kaiser Roll so I am sure that made my burger even better.  The bottomless fries kept coming and they were cool considering they were steak fries, which I am not too much of a fan of.  Workers: No complaints here.  Atmosphere: It was more than I expected. They have nice lighting in Red Robin. TV's everywhere. They were playing Dexter's Laboratory but that was only because there were a lot of kids there for a party. I watched some Dexter while I was waiting for my food.  I would go again.

The first time was great, we went back..service was pretty slow on a slower day...that doesnt normally stop us from going...so we went one more time...that last time made me never want to go again...found a.nice piece of hair in my garlic fries..asked for new fries...they gave me regular fries and it took ten min to come out with the fries...

I have never tried any of Red Robins burgers. I don't have to...since I fell in love with their BLTA croissant sandwich, I don't even have the desire to stray away... Bacon, lettuce, tomato, with avocado on a croissant...C'mon people, it's the greatest sandwich ever!

Red Robin is our regular place to go to eat out.  I get my usual chicken ceasar wrap, which I love, and my husband usually gets a burger.  It's a good place to take kids, like my 2 yr old who loves the freckled fruit and grilled cheese.  Very family friendly place! PS - the salted caramel shake is the best dessert!  my husband and I share the monster size.

Would give no stars if I could.  Party of seven and no service, no acknowledgment that we were even there. Ate 15 minutes of that, we left. We saw 5 waitresses and they had light traffic in the restaurant.  The manager blew past us three times. The only people that bothered to say anything were the hostesses and that was really just the sheer disbelief that we were walking out because we didn't get any service.

Great Service made for a very positive experience. I've been to this location before and the experience was fairly good (the burgers are ALWAYS great), but yesterday I went with my wife and my parents who are from out of town.   My father can be a little grumpy and difficult to please when he goes out to eat, so the service he gets is usually just as important, if not more important, than the quality of the food. Our waitress, Betzy, deserves huge compliments for her genuine service.   There is nothing worse than fake friendliness.  But Betzy brought some seriously honest personality to the mix that made for a very enjoyable meal.     We were a little concerned when she said she promised to put a big smile on my dad's face by the time he was done eating, but she definitely delivered. As usual the burgers were awesome.   The new pub burger was very flavorful and cooked just right.    As a small business owner obsessed about customer service, I'm hoping the service like that from Betzy is recognized and replicated throughout the restaurant.
It's Red Robin!  I frequent this particular location and it's in a convenient area, the food quality is consistent, and the service is friendly.
Every time we go the food is great. Get the sweet potato fries and I recommend the Baileys Irish Creme shake.
Only burger joint with cartoon network playing at the bar!
It's Red Robin.  Get service good chicken sandwich, awesome salad.

I have been taking my grandkids to this Red Robin since the week it opened. Went the other day with one of my grandsons and was refused a table up front and where we always sit, and given a table in the back where the heat was unbearable. After our meal, leaving the restaurant we walked by the front section and there was a man sitting with his two children, I don't know how he got a seat and we didn't. Another grandson (12 years old) wanted to go today and we were refused a table up front and I asked to speak to the manager and was told that the front area was for adults only, she was not very friendly and could not give me an answer why we had seen children in the front area after we were refused a table. My grandson wanted to watch the Nationals game. I have never had any problems with any grandchild misbehaving in this or any restaurant. I always considered this to be a child friendly restaurant, but will not be returning ever. We went to this restaurant at least once a week, but will no spend our money elsewhere.
